title: Every Devoteeâ€™s Journey is Unique, Avoid Comparison | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | SB 3.22.7 | 31.07.2024
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: It is the function of a saintly person to invoke Krishna Consciousness in every forgetful common man.
segments.summary: This segment introduces the importance of a bona fide spiritual master in guiding individuals towards Krishna Consciousness by imparting instructions through oral reception.

segments.key_quote: Bhagavad Gita makes it clear that one can attain the highest perfection of spiritual life simply by offering service according to his ability, just as Arjuna served Krishna by his ability in the military art.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes receiving transcendental messages through oral reception from a spiritual master, who guides individuals to perform duties in Krishna Consciousness according to their abilities, referencing Arjuna's service as a military man.

segments.key_quote: The faithful execution of the instruction which he receives from the spiritual master is the only duty of a disciple and that will bring him perfection.
segments.summary: This segment highlights the importance of receiving instructions from the spiritual master and faithfully executing them to achieve spiritual perfection, emphasizing the disciple's duty and the expert guidance of the spiritual master.

segments.key_quote: When you hear from the authorized source, submissive oral reception, that will cleanse our heart of all the lower gunas.
segments.summary: This segment expresses gratitude for receiving pure words and emphasizes oral reception from an authorized source as a process of spiritual elevation and purification from lower gunas.

segments.key_quote: Krishna consciousness, ultimately, is a path of direct reception of the words that emanate from the transcendental platform.
segments.summary: This segment describes Krishna consciousness as direct reception of transcendental words, explaining how material intellect acts as a barrier and how faith and oral reception are crucial for attaining transcendental intelligence.

segments.key_quote: By hearing, hearing, hearing, it simply purifies one. The moment the intellectual shatter comes, then everything becomes stale.
segments.summary: This segment explains that repeated oral reception of transcendental facts purifies one, and uses the analogy of reading Prabhupada's books to illustrate how intellectual interference can hinder spiritual progress.

segments.key_quote: Moment you have submissive hearing, thousand times you hear Prabhupada saying, you are servant of Krishna, each time is bliss. Each time it gives energy.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the power of submissive hearing and repeated reception of transcendental knowledge, contrasting it with the limitations of material intelligence in achieving spiritual advancement.

segments.key_quote: No spiritual knowledge will stay with you if you have a sense of ownership.
segments.summary: This segment encourages repeated hearing of Prabhupada's books, emphasizing that spiritual knowledge should be approached with a sense of service rather than ownership.

segments.key_quote: There should be a sense of reception. All reception. Welcoming and hearing the sound. That comes from a transcendental source.
segments.summary: This segment explains that transcendental knowledge should be received with a sense of welcoming and hearing, and that wrong feelings stored in the subconscious mind need to be purified for lasting change.

segments.key_quote: Submissive hearing means even the feeling of the speaker will go inside.
segments.summary: This segment discusses how submissive hearing allows feelings to penetrate the subconscious, contrasting short-term memory (chemical state) with long-term memory (structural change in the brain) to explain the need for deep, lasting impact.

segments.key_quote: These things have to go deep inside through feelings. Then there has to be a submissive oral reception.
segments.summary: This segment uses the example of chanting a sloka daily to illustrate how repeated actions create structural changes in the brain, emphasizing the importance of feelings and submissive oral reception for deep, lasting impact.

segments.key_quote: The real fact is that spiritual master knows the nature of a particular man. And what sort of duties he can perform in Krishna consciousness. And he instructs him in that way.
segments.summary: This segment discusses how Srila Prabhupada, despite having thousands of disciples, may have directly instructed only a few, and how the institutional system he set up is a mystical extension of his direct instruction.

segments.key_quote: One should understand that Prabhupada is in our midst.
segments.summary: This segment explains that Prabhupada operates through his servants within the institutional system, and that having faith in this process is crucial for devotees to make advancement.

segments.key_quote: The receiver of instruction should have faith.
segments.summary: This segment shifts focus to the receiver of instruction, emphasizing the importance of faith in Prabhupada operating through the system to receive the right guidance.

segments.key_quote: Each one of us are part of this process.
segments.summary: This segment addresses the bewilderment of receiving instructions within the system, emphasizing that all services are sacred and come through Prabhupada, with temple authorities acting as instruments.

segments.key_quote: The first thing that devotee should learn for several years in his life is not about particular service. It is about servitude.
segments.summary: This segment advises devotees to focus on developing an attitude of servitude and following instructions, rather than over-analyzing the specific service they are assigned.

segments.key_quote: This is the stage for you to learn how to become a. Follow instructions.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes that the initial stage of spiritual life is about learning to be a servant and following instructions, and cautions against upstart thinking and impatience.

segments.key_quote: The formula for unhappiness in spiritual life is when you compare yourself with others.
segments.summary: This segment addresses the problem of devotees comparing their services based on social status, emphasizing that each devotee's journey is unique and comparison leads to unhappiness.

segments.key_quote: We should compare for getting inspired. We should not compare for getting despaired.
segments.summary: This segment clarifies that comparison can be used for inspiration but should be avoided if it leads to despair, highlighting that the habit of comparing is a formula for permanent unhappiness.

segments.key_quote: You should think I am what I am. I am unique.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the uniqueness of each individual and cautions against depression caused by constant comparison, encouraging devotees to recognize their inherent value.

segments.key_quote: Please be what you are in your service. Aspire for devotional qualities.
segments.summary: This segment encourages devotees to focus on devotional qualities rather than social rise, emphasizing the importance of being a servant rather than lording over others.

segments.key_quote: If it is painful for you, do it. If you are enjoying, don't do it.
segments.summary: This segment provides guidance on criticizing and correcting others, emphasizing that it should be done with difficulty and hesitation, driven by a spirit of service rather than enjoyment.

segments.key_quote: They have to associate with the temple. They have to take guidance from the temple.
segments.summary: This segment addresses a question about how devotees outside the institutional system receive guidance, emphasizing the importance of associating with the temple and following the instructions of the authority.

segments.key_quote: Prabhupada wants two things, you should always remember. One is my attitude, another is he wants result.
segments.summary: This segment explains that Prabhupada wants both results and a proper attitude, warning that success can feed false ego and lead to a loss of spiritual power if not approached with humility and service.

segments.key_quote: If you are enjoying, don't do it.
segments.summary: This segment addresses a question about how to criticize someone when one knows they will enjoy it, emphasizing the importance of escalating the issue to a higher authority if one cannot criticize without enjoyment, and adjusting one's approach based on the devotee's consciousness.

segments.key_quote: To criticize a devotee, to get heavy on a devotee, it's not an enjoyable thing.
segments.summary: This segment concludes by reiterating the difficulty of criticizing a devotee and emphasizing that doing so with hesitation and restriction will have the spiritual power to change them.
